#Text=Create Dot Paintings
#Text=Dot painting originates from the Australian Indigenous people , who used to hide sacred meanings behind the paintings .
#Text=This article shows a more modern version of the form of art .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Painting With a Q-tip
#Text=gather the materials .
#Text=This will include paints , water , paper and several Q-tips .

#Text=Watercolor or acrylic paint is best recommended for the paint as you can create lighter or darker hues with the colors and watercolor paper is suggested , thought normal paper will work as well . you will need a Q-tip for each chosen color and remember not mix the Q-tips together .
#Text=You will also need a small amount of water in a bowl and a Q-tip for each chosen color .
#Text=You can keep some tissues in hand to lighten the hues .
#Text=You will need to start by wetting the watercolors with a bit of water .
#Text=To do this , just add about two to three drops of water on the paints and mix it .
#Text=Now it 's finally time for the fun part , painting .
#Text=Dip the Q-tip in the paint so it covers up the bottom of it . dab the Q-tip gently on the paper towel and then press the it on the paper . you will see that it forms a dot .
#Text=The paint on the Q-tip will stay for a short time , so you do n't need to dip it in the paint after every dot .
#Text=Make patterns with the dots , overlap one dot with the another , do anything you want and let your imagination run wild .
#Text=If you want to experiment with techniques first , you can use scrap paper .
#Text=You can even make little circles .
#Text=Cut the Q-tip in half and dip the part without the cotton in the paint and quickly press it on the paper .
#Text=You will need to dip it after every dot , unlike when you 're using the soft bit for it .
#Text=when you Have finished your painting , let it dry .
#Text=You can let it dry naturally or , to make things faster , use a hair dryer .
#Text=You can also dab a clean tissue on the painting to make the colors lighter and also dry faster . do n't touch the painting with bare hands in this process !
#Text=when the art work is finished , you can keep it on a scrap book or uses it as a decoration .
#Text=Keep it on a frame or laminate it .
#Text=Water Drop Painting
#Text=Gather the materials .
#Text=You will need a lot of water , paints , paper , small bowls and a dropper .
#Text=Reccomend using tube paints as it will make it easier to mix with paint and try to use watercolor paper .
#Text=the bowls should be approximately the same size and as small as possible .
#Text=Mix the paint with the water . put a small amount of paint in your one of the bowls and fill it half-way with water .
#Text=Mix the ingredients togather . if the mixture looks a bitt pale keep adding more paint till it 's oppaque .
#Text=Follw this procudure with as many colors as you would like .
#Text=Time for the easy part .
#Text=Fill the dropper with one of the paint mixtures .
#Text=Put one drop of the liquid onto the paper to create a dot .
#Text=folow this process to create your art work .
#Text=When your art work is complete , let it dry naturaly and do n't temper with it .
#Text=Since the droplets are fragile , try to put it somewhere still , because if even one droplet is ruined , it might ruin the whole piece .
#Text=When it is dry , your masterpeice will be complete .
#Text=Video
#Text=Tips
#Text=see dot painting pictures on the intranet for inspiration .
#Text=if you are dot painting on darker paper , consider using lighter colors and less amount of water .
#Text=Do not use a hair on the Water drop dot paint as the wind is too harsh .
#Text=Instead of a Q-tip , you can also use a stick
